meanings.definition: The quality or state of being votive.
meanings.sent1: Her votiveness was evident in the candles she lit at the altar.
meanings.sent2: The church was filled with a sense of votiveness during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The votiveness of the decorations added a peaceful aura to the room.
meanings.sent4: The votiveness of the moment lingered in the air long after the prayer.
meanings.sent5: The votiveness of the shrine made it a sacred place of worship.

meanings.definition: The act of making a vow or offering in a religious context.
meanings.sent1: His votiveness was shown through the offerings he made at the temple.
meanings.sent2: The votiveness of the ceremony was a sign of devotion to their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: She made a votiveness to always light a candle on Sundays.
meanings.sent4: The votiveness of the ritual connected them to their spiritual beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The votiveness of the vow was a solemn promise to the gods.
